intro: Trimeria trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined trimeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have three prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. Trimeria trinervis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
